data.title: Good food, great old fashioned service
data.text: Great place if you're staying in the hotel.  Good food, good service, a little pricey.  Very nice and you may want to wear a suit jacket!

data.title: Fine Dining
data.text: My wife and I visited on a Saturday night.  On occasion, we feel like getting dressed for dinner, a dying tradition.  The filet mignon melted in my mouth and my wife says her pork chop was the best she ever tasted.  The presentation was impressive, and the prep was good.  It is an open grill layout so you can watch the chefs at work.  The wait staff is well-trained and are attentive without being obtrusive.  Being in the Battle House is a bonus.

data.title: Quality food and service
data.text: Staff was very attentive to my dietary restrictions, offering suggestions and substitutions as necessary. Crab cakes and scallops were superb. Risotto was a bit salty.

data.title: Have Mercy!!!
data.text: Best combination of appetizer, dinner, and desert I've experienced in some time!!!  Why go anywhere else than depart your room and head down stairs.  Breakfast was fabulous too!!!!

data.title: Fine dining and great atmosphere
data.text:
The Trellis Room is a must for breakfast. A large spread of delicious food including  fresh fruit and berries ( that were amazing), bacon, eggs several ways, made to order omelets, biscuits and gravy, French toast, pastries, oatmeal, hashbrowns, grits, etc. Also an assortment of fine cheeses and meats. 
Dinner is quite pricy, but it is fine dining with excellent service in a great atmosphere. I recommend any fresh seafood. I had the scallops which were delicious.

data.title: A bit pricey...Good Food
data.text: Like all hotel restaurants the prices are a bit high.  However, the quality of the food is exceptional.  The wait staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu selections.  The decor is fabulous!

data.title: Disappointed
data.text:
Was very disappointed at the menu offerings and the quality of the food.
The chicken was the least expensive item on the menu and they were out of it and had just begun the dinner service. My husband and son got sick after dinner.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Trellis Room, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear SweetToothAfterDine,

Thank you for visiting the Trellis Room Restaurant at the Battle House Hotel & Spa.  I appreciate your feedback and comments.  I do apologize to you and your family that the restaurant and menu selection did not meet your expectations and you were disappointed with your visit.  

I have shared your feedback with the hotel's F&B Team for their immediate review and follow-up.  Thank you for bringing this to my attention.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: SUMPTOUS BREAKFAST BUFFET
data.text:
I ate breakfast there this am.
I was there at 06:30 when doors opened.
Extensive good quality fresh fruit including raspberries, blackberries, strawberries and more.
Eggs cooked to order including omelettes.
Fresh OJ. Bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, and pastries and many other options to chose from.
Service great.
Trellis room is beautiful setting.
Good for $20.

data.title: An exceptional dining experience!!!
data.text: We checked into the Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel and were greeted with a complimentary happy hour sangria punch and cheese plate!! Then we went to The Trellis Room for dinner. The waitress was so very attentive and explained the menu items with great knowledge. As appetizers we had the Gulf Coast Shrimp and Grits  and the Alabama Lump Crab Cake. Both were superb! We raved to our waitress and she must have told the chef because she promptly came to our table to discuss the menu and offered us special tastings of some pickled red grapes and 2 special cheeses. We had a wonderful evening all around. Truly a 4 star restaurant. Prices were not unreasonable for the selection. Thank you Trellis room staff.

data.title: Special dining experience
data.text: Our food and wine was superb.  The waitstaff was knowledgable and cheerful without being over-bearing. The menu was varied and the wine list interesting with many different wines offered.  It was a treat at a table that was correctively and beautifully set.  Certainly the one training the staff deserves compliments!  We took the time to thank the chefs, too, and they seemed genuinely pleased.

data.title: Very good restaurant
data.text: Enjoyed dining at the Trellis room. Nice atmosphere, good food and excellent service. Historic dining area well restored for modern dining.

data.title: A little expensive and slow service
data.text: Had slow service here for the breakfast buffet, but we were in a rush to get somewhere, so it was exaggerated for us. The breakfast buffet choices were fine and the food was decent, but it was a little expensive for what it it. But I guess that is to be expected in a hotel restaurant.

data.title: Upscale but down home with good cooking
data.text: Sous vide buttermilk chicken had just the right crunch and the chicken was very moist with no grease. The side of greens with ham hock gravy was a perfect complement to the chicken.

data.title: Very good steak
data.text: We went to dinner here. And wow the prices were high. I am not an adventurous person when it comes to food. So I went with the steak which was fantastic and the vegetables were yummy. The crab cake was amazing though small. I wanted more. And oh the bread and butter were awesome. We had great service. My glass was always full and the wait staff were paying attention when a dish was finished they would come and take it.

data.title: Good quality food for not so cheap price.
data.text: Food was Good and good service as well. But the price was on the higher side. A pretty decent 2 course and a pint of beer will cost around $50

data.title: After Christmas return visit follow up...
data.text: After my previous review  "Thought it would be a nice place for Christmas dinner" I was contacted by Gary Smith (director of outlets) and my mom and i were invited back for a return visit. WOW is all i can say he really went out of his way to make up for the issues we had during our Christmas visit. He took is on a tour of the hotel where we got to visit multiple roof top locations instead of the one we missed during Christmas the views were great. Following the tour we had dinner in the trellis room where the food was great far exceeding our Christmas experience. We both had appetizers one being the fried green tomatoes wich was delicious a must try! For our entrees we both had the ribeye wich was really good as well. I have never experienced a manager that was so happy to make things right after a bad visit that is rare nowadays but was certainly appreciated! Thank you Gary Smith:)

data.title: Five stars for sure !
data.text:
We were staying at the Battle House Hotel and we went to eat there twice in 2 days....
The food is awesome...and the restaurant very classy

data.title: Thought it would be a nice place for Christmas dinner:( 2015
data.text: I took my family (mom, husband, and myself) here for Christmas dinner with hopes that it would be great. My mom had always wanted to try it and I figured what a better time than Christmas? We got off to a disappointing start, I was told during making reservations that they would give me a key so I could take my mom to the top floor to see the view, however when I asked for one upon arrival they said it was closed for maintenance. Then we proceeded to brunch where I hoped things would get better and they had so it would seem. The complimentary  mimosa's, the bread and butter, even the appetizers were all wonderful then came the entrees, my mom had the prime rib which looked great but was chewy and hard to cut, then my entrée of scallops that were so salty I could only eat one (and I like salt) the only good entrée was my husbands chicken. The manager (I think) came by and asked about our entrees my mom kept her mouth shut about the prime rib, but I did however tell him about my scallops he apologized and thanked me for letting him know but did not offer to have the dish remade so I simply didn't eat this course. And then there was the problem with the wait staff very nice girls not rude at all just very inexperienced, at one point my husband had to help hold the tray of soup to keep it from spilling on him, we also had to move things on the table so she could sit the tray on the table to serve us other wise the food would have been on the floor, all of this for a 3 top. Please know that I am grateful they chose to work on Christmas and I tipped them well regardless but when one pays this much money for dinner they kind of expect it to be good. All that being said the bad execution of the entrees combined with the lack of experience of the wait staff, and not being able to take my mom to the balcony, I doubt we will return here again. I guess there is always next year.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Trellis Room, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Jennifer G,

Thank you for taking the time to send in your feedback from your recent visit to the Trellis Room Restaurant at the Battle House Hotel & Spa.  I would like to offer you my sincere apologies for the 8th floor rooftop terrace being closed.  Unfortunately, we had to close this area due to the heavy rains that came through and caused some damage to the terrace area.  This is being repaired as we speak and should be completed by the first of next week.  Once repaired, you are welcome to stop by the hotel any time and gain access to this area.  I would also like to offer you my sincere apologies for the quality of food you received and the lack of experience that was shown by some of the wait staff you encountered.  I have forwarded your review to the hotel's Director of Outlets and to the B&F Manager for their review and follow up.  I appreciate you taking the time to send in your feedback so that we may follow up and correct these issues.  

We appreciate you choosing the Battle House Hotel & Spa and Trellis Room Restaurant as your place to share the holidays with your family.  Again, my apologies that we did not live up to your expectations and make this a special occasion for you.

I hope that you will give the Trellis Room Restaurant and hotel another try in the future so that we may have another opportunity to try and meet and exceed your expectations.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Breakfast!
data.text: Stayed at he Hotel where this Restaurant is located in. Breakfast Buffet was great, fine dining at night was good but they could do more with the portion size.. I had to ask where the rest of my meal was! very pricey indeed, especially fir dinner.

data.title: Five star dining in the Battle House Hotel
data.text: I lived/stayed in the Battle house for a few months last year and had a number of fantastic meals at the Trellis Room including a phenomenal steak and a number of good sandwiches. Great service, nice wine list, and nice ambiance round out the great visits to the trellis room.
